author: Jake Polden
title: Jamie Carragher slams Liverpool AND Leicester City after Foxes win - 'Both teams should hang their heads in shame'
text:
Jamie Carragher said the Foxes' display reinforced that players didn't do enough under Claudio Ranieri (Photo: AFP) Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
Jamie Carragher was critical of both Liverpool and Leicester City following the Foxes 3-1 win at the King Power Stadium on Monday. 
He slammed Jurgen Klopp's men, saying they should "hang their heads in shame" after they were soundly beaten in all areas of the park. 
But also hit out at the Leicester players for the quality of their performance on the back of six Premier League fixtures without a single goal. 
"I don't think I have ever seen a game of football where two teams should come off the pitch and hang their head in shame," said the Reds legend. Carragher slammed Jurgen Klopp's men after their 3-1 defeat (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
"Liverpool for how bad they were and Leicester for how good they were on the back of how poor they have been, just through effort and commitment." 
Carragher added that the performances reinforced the fact that players did not do enough for the team under Claudio Ranieri. 
Although admitted that they were likely to get criticised regardless of their performance. Jamie Vardy celebrates scoring his second against the Reds (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
Gary Neville, who revealed he was baffled by the way in which the Foxes responded following the Italian's sacking, pointed out that the players were "at it all night". 
He added that they made the decision to play tonight, and claims Craig Shakespeare will not have had any influence of the team in such a short period of time. poll loading Will Shakespeare become Leicester's next permanent manager? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
